file_content.text: Enough. The Republic has taken much from me. It's time to hand off the crown.
Let me serve you. Together we can destroy Rogun and retake my empire... in your name.
With your skills and the knowledge of my years, no one will stand against us.
Make it worth my while and I'll let you take a chance with that escape pod.
Talk and I'll let you walk.
Hardly a generous offer, once you've destroyed my men and led the Republic right to me.
But I would rather face them than you.
I will transmit the locations of Rogun's known safe houses and his private stashes. If you cannot defeat him with that, you don't deserve to.
One way or another, you're going in. Help me take down Rogun, and at least he won't be laughing at you.
You're going back to jail.
Fine. If I am to rot here, let him do the same.
Rogun is still using our same network of secret bases. I will send you the coordinates when you have delivered me safely to Republic custody.
Go ahead, call your handler. Tell her you've fetched as ordered and deserve your bone.
Captain. I wasn't sure comlinks would work that far in. Is... you have Ivory in custody?
Nah, I just decided to start a decrepit Rattataki collection.
Do I really need to answer?
I told you I'd bring him in.
Of course.
You've got a reputation, you know. Can't blame me for doubting.
It would be more flattering if you didn't sound so surprised.
[Flirt] Did you doubt me?
From what I hear, you have no shortage of women to fan your ego, Captain.
Apparently there's some ancient spacecraft stashed here he thought he could escape in.
He's got an escape pod.
We'll look into it.
I'll notify Commander Skylast. I'm sure he can spare a few men to pull this thorn from our side.
Look me up when you get back to base, Captain. I have a feeling there's more to this story.
You stay on my ship, you do what I tell you, and you don't leave my sight.
Deal... partner.
Exactly the terms I would set.
The sun has set on my prime, I see that. It will take more to reclaim my empire than to fool these imbeciles.
What would you have me do?
Give me everything you've got on our buddy the Butcher.
Let's focus on Rogun.
You still got any contacts on the outside? Let's get the band back together.
I need allies.
You got any black market sources I don't know about?
I'm always looking for tech.
Once we're off Belsavis, I can see who's still active.
I'll put together a list of all of my and Rogun's former safe houses. He was never one to change a routine once it worked.
You don't even have to ask, Captain. I'll call the ship, tell them to come pick him up.
I'll call the ship to pick him up, then? Are you sure you want to do this?
I will tell the ship to get him.
A wise plan. Shall I contact the ship to pick him up?
Ooh, Rogun's gonna wet the bed when he hears this one. I'll call the ship and tell them to grab him.
Why don't you contact your ship?
That seems a far safer way to travel than unearthing a wreck that's been on ice for five thousand years.
Steady and calm. We've no need to draw attention.
The one the Republic sent is already here.
If you help me find Rogun the Butcher, the Republic authorized me to cut you a deal.
I have an offer of leniency.
My heart leaps. Pray, what do they offer? My own vidscreen? Rehabilitation on Coruscant with a house-arrest collar?
I could use a man with your experience. Join my crew and I'll get you off this rock.
Work with me.
You offer mere words against what I have held in my hands.
You're going back to your cell.
Give yourself up.
You think this time it will hold me?
The Republic cannot stop me. They hide behind sealed doors and force fields, while I explore the treasures of this world.
You want that I kill him, boss?
Gonna be me this time, Squarg. Whatcha wanna bet? Lay that shirt on the line? How about the boots?
They cannot even track their prisoners, while I have mastered the secrets of a race that once ruled this galaxy!
Oh, yeah? Anything you want to, you know, share?
Secrets?
You are a woman of action. It would bore you to sit for days, unraveling the workings of machines that were ancient when humans first learned speech.
You are a man who prefers action to contemplation. You could not grasp the workings of a machine more ancient than half the stars in our sky.
What ancient race? You're talking nonsense.
You're bluffing.
You think to draw out my secrets with simple taunts? Shall I strive to impress you?
The Empire only found this forgotten world when I called them--on the transmitter abandoned millennia ago by the creators of Belsavis.
Be careful. Ivory is known for a lot of things, but bluffing wasn't one of them.
Creators? How do you create a planet?
He lies.
If the Empire had known of Belsavis sooner, they would not have waited.
Even I know ancient machines plus a power-hungry madman is usually a bad equation.
You're not getting away with this.
This ends here.
Squarg, Buzz, take care of this distraction. Meet us later. At the ship.
I'm gonna feed you your guts.
Subtlety isn't Squarg's strong suit.
You say Squarg not strong? I crush you, little bug!
And then I climb out the gaping hole where your brain should be!
Get him!
Don't tell me what to do!
A real man wouldn't let some bug get away with making fun of you.
Don't take that, Squarg.
Yeah! You shut your mouth, you--you bug-head!
I'm sorry. Are you afraid I might use words with more than one syllable?
Yeah! You wanna fight me?
Bring it on, big guy. I'll even help you. That end of the blaster goes in front.
Arrr!
[Shoot them in the back]
You two are getting on my nerves.
Shut up and fight, already.
Oh, for the love of... Squarg, just hit the pretty girl!
Oh, for the love of... Squarg, shut up and smash him!
Didn't I kill you?
But you guys are here to bust Ivory out, right? Get him and Rogun back together? No?
You're killing Ivory?
You come this far and stay so ignorant?
You have made it here--for that reason alone, I must respect you. Do you still wish to deal?
Help me take down Rogun... starting with his bloodhounds here.
My deal's still open, Ivory.
You've proved there's more to you than the flash of a blaster. I'm listening.
Yes. Every minute I live, Rogun courts his death.
What deal do you offer?
You surprise me, Captain. I did not think you would make it this far.
We seem to have a... mutual interest... in destroying Rogun. Do you still wish to deal?
If you want my help, you'd better know more than Rogun's favorite beer.
What can you give me?
Rogun drinks brandy. Luranian.
Much more helpful.
There we are. Got what we came for....
We're wasting our time.
Hey, he's right! With a Champala-lime spritz and not too much ice. Not that you'll ever need to know this....
And he has a safe house on Tatooine, along with at least twelve other planets I know of.
Help me, and I'll make sure you're treated well when you're back in custody.
Accept the Republic's terms.
No deal. I will not end my days in a cage.
If I take you on, I'm in charge. I talk, you listen.
You work for me.
You're hardly the first who's thought to take my place.
This vault holds an escape vessel, abandoned here by the race who built this planet. It is the only way off without Republic aid.
Let us be partners. Help me launch the craft and defeat this rabble, and together we can reclaim what Rogun stole from me.
[Laughter]
[More Laughter]
I'm Rogun's best--you think a few shots to the head can stop me?
Now my brothers who were sentenced here add their strength to my own.
We will finish you. And we will finish Ivory. Rogun will be pleased.
Rogun was a fool to send you here instead of kill you.
Now I'm going to finish the job.
Rogun should have killed you the first time. It was a waste of mercy to send you here.
You don't scare me.
This ends now, old man. Like it should have when Rogun sent you here.
Haha.
Never!
Hold off the captain. Ivory is your first priority!
You want that I kill her, boss?
You're comedians, not killers.
Get her!
